DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Surgery Specific Complication Reconstructive Flap Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind of  reconstructive flap complication specific to head and neck surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Surgery Specified Complication Reconstructive Surgery Flap
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any surgery involving a structure in the head and neck region._Clearly and explicitly stated._Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure._Surgical restoration of function or form of a part._A unit of tissue that is transferred from one site to another while maintaining its own blood supply.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition in which there is inadequate blood flow through a vein.

Concepts.definition: A condition in which there is inadequate blood flow through a vein.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition in which there is inadequate blood flow through an artery.

Concepts.definition: A condition in which there is inadequate blood flow through an artery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or affecting only a part of something.: A cell death process that is morphologically characterized by a gain in cell volume (oncosis), swelling of organelles, plasma membrane rupture and subsequent loss of intracellular contents.: A unit of tissue that is transferred from one site to another while maintaining its own blood supply.

Concepts.definition: Being or affecting only a part of something.
A cell death process that is morphologically characterized by a gain in cell volume (oncosis), swelling of organelles, plasma membrane rupture and subsequent loss of intracellular contents.
A unit of tissue that is transferred from one site to another while maintaining its own blood supply.
